subject: Programming
title: Binary Search Trees
description: A 60-second lesson on Binary Search Trees.

hook.text: Put smaller values left, larger values right. Now finding any value takes only log n steps.

buildup.text: A binary search tree keeps elements sorted by structure. Each comparison eliminates half the remaining tree.

discovery.text: Search, insert, and delete all run in O(log n) when the tree is balanced. Logarithmic is fast.

twist.text: Insert sorted data into a BST and it becomes a straight line â€” O(n) per operation, like a list.

climax.text: Self-balancing trees like AVL and Red-Black trees prevent this degeneration automatically.

punchline.text: Halving the search at each step is powerful.

quiz.question: What is the time complexity of searching a balanced BST?
